activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Consecutive to: Case 22CF750

miscConds.notes: Successful Completion of Drug Treatment Program. No violent contact with victim Y.R unless victim consents and it is approved by agent. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

1:31 PM Defendant Zachary J Nelson in court.  Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Zachary J Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore.

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 22CF750
Plea - Cts. 3 and 4: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Cts. 1 and 2 is dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 4 months Racine County Jail each count (consecutive); imposed and stayed for 30 months probation

Conditions of Probation:
6 months Racine County Jail; STAYED
Absolute sobriety; 
Must comply with Drug Court Treatment
No violent contact with victim Y.R unless victim consents and approval from agent. 
No weapons; weapons used in case 22CF750 must be destroyed; 
SCRAM unit ordered;
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge.

Case 22CF887
Plea - Amended Ct. 2 to Misdemeanor bail jumping and Ct. 3: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Cts. 1, 4 and 5 are dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 4 months Racine County Jail each count (consecutive); imposed and stayed for 30 months probation; if Revoked sentence will run consecutive to case 22CF750.

Conditions of Probation:
6 months Racine County Jail; STAYED
Absolute sobriety; 
Must comply with Drug Court Treatment
No violent contact with victim Y.R. unless victim consents and approval from agent. 
No weapons;

Adjustment Number: 22A 412039,
Payable Number: 459357,
Receipt Number: 22R 006258F,
Amount: $20.00
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**
